item.title: 菲律宾因特拉米风暴死亡人数增至 70 人，风暴风险卷土重来
item.description: 强烈热带风暴 "特拉米 "在菲律宾造成的死亡人数上升到至少 70 人，这个东南亚国家正在为新的气旋和 "特拉米 "可能卷土重来做好准备。【原文：The death toll in the Philippines from Severe Tropical Storm Trami rose to at least 70, and the Southeast Asian nation is bracing for a new cyclone and Trami’s possible return.】

item.title: 英国气候监察机构敦促在 2035 年前加快减排步伐
item.description: 英国气候变化监督机构表示，英国政府应加快消除地球变暖气体的努力，并承诺到 2035 年将碳排放量减少 81%。【原文：The British government should accelerate efforts to eliminate planet-warming gases and commit to an 81% reduction in carbon emissions by 2035, the nation’s climate change watchdog said.】

item.title: 监管机构指责 Keystone 运营商造成泄漏
item.description: 根据美国监管机构的一份报告，Keystone 输油管道的运营商对 2022 年导致近 13,000 桶原油从管道泄漏的故障负有部分责任。【原文：The operator of the Keystone pipeline is partly to blame for failures that contributed to the spilling of nearly 13,000 barrels of crude from the line in 2022, according to a report by US regulators.】

item.title: Sunrun 首席执行官表示正在洽谈向数据中心供应太阳能产品事宜
item.description: Sunrun Inc. 首席执行官玛丽-鲍威尔（Mary Powell）表示，公司正在与数据中心开发商商讨为其设施提供分布式太阳能发电的事宜。【原文：Sunrun Inc. is in discussions with data center developers to supply distributed solar power generation for their facilities, Chief Executive Officer Mary Powell said.】

item.title: 联合国生物多样性谈判中点从 "实施 "转向 "鼓励
item.description:
在哥伦比亚，谈判人员正在解决一系列棘手的问题，特别是如何为生态系统保护提供资金。【原文：

In Colombia, negotiators are working through a host of thorny issues, particularly how to finance ecosystem protection.

】

item.title: 核电初创企业太平洋核聚变公司获得 9 亿美元融资
item.description: 太平洋核聚变公司（Pacific Fusion Corp.）是一家试图创造核聚变能源的电力公司，该公司表示已筹集到超过 9 亿美元的资金，使这家名不见经传的初创公司在一个不断发展的行业中跃居前列。【原文：Pacific Fusion Corp., a power company that is attempting to create a nuclear fusion-based energy source, said it has raised over $900 million, putting the unknown startup near the top of a growing industry.】

item.title: 科技界有一个为地球降温的激进计划
item.description: 今天的时事通讯将关注硅谷正在兴起的一个想法：调暗太阳以降低热量，以及这个想法背后的科幻灵感。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读和分享本篇报道的完整版。如需无限制地获取气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at an idea taking hold in Silicon Valley: dimming the sun to turn down the heat, and the sci-fi inspiration behind it. item.title: 必和必拓与淡水河谷就巴西大坝灾难达成 300 亿美元和解协议
item.description: 巴西已同意接受就淡水河谷公司（Vale SA）和必和必拓集团（BHP Group）的铁矿石合资企业 2015 年发生的矿难达成的 1,700 亿雷亚尔（合 299 亿美元）的和解协议。【原文：Brazil has agreed to accept a 170 billion-real ($29.9 billion) settlement for a 2015 mining disaster at Vale SA and BHP Group’s iron-ore joint venture.】

item.title: 能源高管称，人工智能驱动的电力需求实际上对气候有利
item.description:
从化石燃料中获利的公司声称，从长远来看，数据中心带动的电力需求增长将引发对清洁能源的投资—  

。【原文：

Companies that profit from fossil fuels claim the increase in electricity demand driven by data centers will trigger investment in clean energy — in the long run.  

】

item.title: 硅谷精英倾资遮蔽阳光
item.description:
风险资本家、初创企业创始人和技术高管正在资助有争议技术的研究、实验和小规模部署，这些技术可能会给地球降温。【原文：

Venture capitalists, startup founders and tech executives are funding studies, experiments and small deployments of controversial technology that could cool the planet.

】

item.title: 美国年轻人在气候变化问题上的性别分歧在扩大
item.description:
与男性同龄人相比，Z 世代女性更担心全球变暖问题。【原文：

Gen Z women are more worried about global warming than their male peers.

】

item.title: 暴雨成灾，欧洲将面临更多农作物损失和破坏
item.description: 欧洲的农民面对一些田地里仍在腐烂和染病的庄稼，由于越来越多的降雨推迟了冬季播种，他们看到了未来更多的痛苦。【原文：Europe’s farmers, faced with rotting and diseased crops still sitting in some fields, see more pain ahead as ever more rain delays winter planting.】

item.title: 密西西比河在美国农民最困难的时候再次干涸
item.description: 密西西比河连续第三个秋天出现低水位，这是美国农民每年依靠这条河向全世界运送农作物的关键时刻。【原文：The Mississippi River is suffering from low waters for the third straight autumn, a crucial time of year when American farmers rely on the route to deliver their crops to the world.】

item.title: 两极分化的输油管道法在玉米种植大州被列入选票
item.description: 一条耗资 89 亿美元的碳捕集管道提案使美国玉米带两极分化，目前正面临最大的障碍之一：选举日。【原文：A proposed $8.9-billion carbon-capture pipeline that has polarized the US Corn Belt is facing one of its biggest obstacles yet: Election Day.】

item.title: 南非与能源合作伙伴商讨贷款担保事宜
item.description: 南非正在与国际气候融资伙伴商谈为能源基础设施建设贷款提供担保的事宜。【原文：South Africa is in talks with its international climate-finance partners over the provision of guarantees for loans for the construction of energy-related infrastructure.】

item.title: 煤炭行业亿万富翁泰凯克（Tykac）着眼于扩张，与环境、社会和公司治理（ESG）对赌
item.description: 当大多数投资者远离煤炭时，捷克亿万富翁帕维尔-蒂卡克（Pavel Tykac）却在加倍投资这种肮脏的燃料，只是不在他的祖国。【原文：As most investors turn away from coal, Czech billionaire Pavel Tykac is doubling down on the dirty fuel — just not in his home country.】

item.title: 米尔顿飓风几乎未给巨灾债券基金造成损失
item.description: 经过两周的数字计算，现在看来，巨灾债券投资者在飓风米尔顿的袭击中显然相对安然无恙。【原文：After two weeks of number-crunching, it now seems clear that investors in catastrophe bonds emerged from Hurricane Milton relatively unscathed.】

item.title: 拜登政府批准开采锂矿，争相增加供应
item.description: 拜登政府首次批准开采锂矿，加大了将美国关键矿产供应链从中国转移出去的力度。【原文：The Biden administration has issued its first approval for a lithium mine, ramping up efforts to shift the US critical minerals supply chain away from China.】

item.title: 野火蔓延速度加快，美国西部趋势令人担忧
item.description:
科学家发现，在美国，快速移动的地狱之火是造成大多数火灾相关财产损失的罪魁祸首— 而且在过去 20 年中，它们的移动速度变得更快了。【原文：

Fast-moving infernos are responsible for most fire-related property damage in the US — and they’ve gotten even faster over the past 20 years, scientists found.

】

item.title: 加拿大以补贴换限期，通用汽车面临电动车挤压
item.description: 通用汽车公司（General Motors Co.【原文：General Motors Co. said governments in Canada are pulling back on subsidies for electric cars at an awkward time — just as they want carmakers to ramp up sales of cleaner vehicles.】

item.title: 投资 14 亿美元，布隆迪将从 2025 年起扩建电网
item.description: 布隆迪约有 10%的人口用上了电，在国际机构 14 亿美元资金的推动下，布隆迪将从明年起扩大配电网。【原文：Burundi, where about 10% of the population has access to electricity, will see the expansion of its power-distribution grid from next year, boosted by $1.4 billion of funding from international agencies.】

item.title: SSE 获得 30 亿英镑与可持续发展挂钩的贷款，用于资助净零排放项目
item.description: 英国发电公司 SSE Plc 及其输电部门签署了新的与可持续发展挂钩的循环信贷额度，总额达 30 亿英镑（39 亿美元），以支持五年净零计划。【原文：British power generator SSE Plc and its transmission unit have signed new sustainability-linked revolving credit facilities for £3 billion ($3.9 billion) to support a five-year net zero plan.】

item.title: 联合国称全球将升温达 3.1C
item.description:
马达加斯加是唯一一个加强其2030年气候目标的国家，这意味着目前没有迹象表明地球正在改变其危险的排放轨迹。【原文：

Madagascar is the only country to strengthen its 2030 climate target, meaning there are currently no signs the planet is on track to change its dangerous emissions trajectory. 

】

item.title: 飓风 "特拉米 "持续增强，菲律宾努力限制风暴造成的损失
item.description: 强热带风暴 "特拉米 "已造成 25 人死亡，数百万人受灾，政府办公楼已于周五连续第三天关闭。【原文：The Philippines is ramping up efforts to contain the devastation caused by severe tropical storm Trami, which has killed 25 people, affected millions and shut government offices for a third straight day on Friday.】

item.title: Blackstone 向可再生能源公司 Pine Gate 投资 2.88 亿美元
item.description: Blackstone Inc. 将向储能和太阳能公司 Pine Gate Renewables 投资 2.88 亿美元，作为其推动可再生能源融资的一部分。【原文：Blackstone Inc. is investing $288 million in energy storage and solar company Pine Gate Renewables, as part of its push toward financing renewable energy.】

item.title: 俄罗斯称无法建造北极航道所需的所有船只
item.description: 俄罗斯副总理尤里-特鲁特涅夫（Yury Trutnev）表示，俄罗斯正面临着巨大的 "北方海路 "项目所需的冰级货船短缺问题，因为俄罗斯无法自行建造船队。【原文：Russia is facing a deficit of ice-class cargo vessels for its gigantic Northern Sea Route project as the nation cannot build the fleet on its own, according to Deputy Prime Minister Yury Trutnev.】

item.title: 国家机构警告：荷兰不太可能实现气候目标
item.description: 一家国家机构警告说，如果政府不采取果断的政策，荷兰要实现欧盟大幅减排的约束性目标似乎遥不可及。【原文：The Netherlands’ ability to reach the European Union’s binding target of significantly reducing emissions appears out of reach with no decisive government policy, a state agency has warned.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利与 Climeworks 达成碳清除协议
item.description: 摩根士丹利已与 Climeworks AG 达成协议，为清除大气中的二氧化碳提供资金，摩根士丹利与摩根大通公司等华尔街重量级企业一起，为这项新兴技术提供支持。【原文：Morgan Stanley has entered into a deal with Climeworks AG to finance the removal of CO2 from the atmosphere, joining other Wall Street heavyweights including JPMorgan Chase & Co. in throwing its weight behind the nascent technology.】

item.title: 更多公司放弃垃圾碳抵消，但新买家迫在眉睫
item.description:
尽管联合国气候峰会上的交易有可能卷土重来，但企业采购商仍在远离被监督机构评为无效的项目。【原文：

Corporate purchasers are moving away from projects rated ineffective by a watchdog even as dealmaking at the UN climate summit offers potential for a comeback.

】
